thread.title: Shark washes up in puddle on Australian street after Cylone Debbie
thread.title_full: Shark washes up in puddle on Australian street after Cylone Debbie

author: Associated Press in Ayr, Queensland, Australia
title: Shark washes up in puddle on Australian street after Cylone Debbie
text:
Cyclone Debbie Shark washes up in puddle on Australian street after Cylone Debbie 
A journalist filming floods in the aftermath of the cyclone found a dead bull shark in the town of Ayr, prompting locals to draw connections to Sharknado A bull shark that washed up on a road near the town of Ayr in Queensland, Australia after a powerful cyclone on 30 March 2017. Photograph: STR/AFP/Getty Images Cyclone Debbie Shark washes up in puddle on Australian street after Cylone Debbie 
A journalist filming floods in the aftermath of the cyclone found a dead bull shark in the town of Ayr, prompting locals to draw connections to Sharknado View more sharing options Associated Press in Ayr, Queensland, Australia   16.51 BST 
An Australian journalist covering flooding from Cyclone Debbie was shocked to come across a dead bull shark that was apparently swept up in the deluge. 
WIN News reporter Philip Calder told news.com.au that he was in the town of Ayr to shoot video of a flooded road and couldn’t believe it when he came across a shark in a puddle. He said the shark is “the talk of the town” and many locals have turned out to touch it. 
Some social media users are drawing a connection between the shark and Syfy’s Sharknado film series , which features sharks getting swept up in cyclones and wreaking havoc on cities. 
Cyclone Debbie knocked out power to thousands when it slammed ashore with winds up to 260km/h (160mph) Tuesday. Topics
